title: My French Press Method
desc: After years of experimentation, I've perfected my French press technique. It all starts with the right grind size - coarse, like sea salt. I use a 1:15 coffee-to-water ratio and steep for exactly 4 minutes. What's your preferred method?
content:
After years of experimentation, I've perfected my French press technique. It all starts with the right grind size - coarse, like sea salt. I use 1:15 coffee to water ratio and steep for exactly 4 minutes. 
 Here's my step-by-step process: 
 1- Grind fresh beans to a coarse consistency Heat water to 200°F (93°C) 
 2- Add ground coffee to the French press Pour a small amount of water to bloom the coffee for 30 seconds 
 3- Add the remaining water and place the lid on with the plunger pulled up Wait exactly 4 minutes 
 4- Slowly press the plunger down Pour immediately into your cup to prevent over-extraction 
 I've found this method consistently produces a full-bodied cup with rich flavors and minimal bitterness. The key factors are water temperature, grind consistency, and steep time. What French press techniques have worked well for you?
